availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Owingsville, Kentucky, circuit clerk, attorney, and politician. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas I. Young and Elizabeth Young. Married to Mary R. Bell Young on June 26, 1856. Resident of Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Owingsville in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 to 1863. Clerk of the Bath County Circuit Court in 1865.
He was the Notary Public in Bath County.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 1st division, p. 109. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 1. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky (Louisville, KY: Richard H. Collins, 1877), 47.
